meaningRev: Collaboration failing, skill unrecognized or insufficient. Apprenticeship without learning. Quality compromised. The building proving unsound. Teamwork undermined by ego or poor coordination. Craftsmanship dishonored. Plans never manifesting. Effort not combining effectively.
description: A sculptor at his work in a monastery. Compare the design which illustrates the Eight of Pentacles. The apprentice or amateur therein has received his reward and is now at work in earnest.

name: Four of Pentacles
meaningUp: Security, stability, control over resources, conservation, holding on. Foundations solid. Material comfort achieved and protected. Financial prudence. Possession and ownership. The security that comes from having and holding.
meaningRev: Security becoming hoarding or control lost entirely. Stability through greed or instability through loss. Resources protected obsessively or squandered carelessly. Holding on too tightly strangling life, or letting go carelessly losing everything. The foundations secure but life unlived, or foundations crumbling despite efforts.
description: A crowned figure, having a pentacle over his crown, clasps another with hands and arms; two pentacles are under his feet. He holds to that which he has.

name: Five of Pentacles
meaningUp: Hardship, poverty, illness, exclusion, loss. Material and spiritual destitution. The outsiders looking in at warmth and plenty. Hard times. Need for help. The test of faith through suffering. Isolation in difficulty.
meaningRev: Hardship lifting or deepening. Moving from poverty toward recovery or falling further. Illness healing or worsening. Exclusion ending or becoming complete. Loss recovered or permanent. Finding help or help refused. The door to warmth opened or firmly closed. Faith through suffering restored or destroyed.
description: Two mendicants in a snow-storm pass a lighted casement.

name: Six of Pentacles
meaningUp: Generosity, charity, sharing wealth, balance of giving and receiving. Resources distributed fairly. Patronage, support, gratitude. The scales balanced between giver and receiver. Paying it forward. Recognition of abundance through giving.
meaningRev: Generosity thwarted or corrupted into control through giving. Charity with strings attached or needed but not available. Imbalance between giving and receiving. Resources distributed unfairly. Patronage becoming domination. Support withdrawn or offered with conditions. The scales tipped to exploit rather than help.
description: A person in the guise of a merchant weighs money in a pair of scales and distributes it to the needy and distressed. It is a testimony to his own success in life, as well as to his goodness of heart.

name: Seven of Pentacles
meaningUp: Assessment, patience, long-term view, investment review. Pause to evaluate progress. The harvest not yet ready. Sustained effort, delayed gratification. Questioning if current path will bear fruit. Contemplating return on investment.
meaningRev: Assessment revealing poor returns or impatience preventing proper evaluation. The pause becoming permanent hesitation or prematurely ended. Long-term view lost to short-term thinking. Investment failing or panic causing premature withdrawal. Patience exhausted or practiced past usefulness. The harvest declared failed too soon or overdue.
description: A young man, leaning on his staff, looks intently at seven pentacles attached to a clump of greenery on his right; one would say that these were his treasures and that his heart was there.

name: Eight of Pentacles
meaningUp: Diligence, skill development, craftsmanship, apprenticeship, dedication to mastery. Quality through repetition. Work as meditation. Attention to detail. Building expertise. Commitment to excellence. The artisan at the bench.
meaningRev: Diligence wavering or becoming obsessive perfectionism. Skill development thwarted or rushed. Craftsmanship declining through inattention or unrewarded. Dedication without progress. Quality sacrificed to speed. Work becoming drudgery. The apprentice who won't learn or can't. Effort expended without increasing skill.
description: An artist in stone at his work, which he exhibits in the form of trophies.

name: Nine of Pentacles
meaningUp: Independence, self-sufficiency, luxury earned, refinement, solitude chosen. The garden cultivated bringing abundant harvest. Material success through own effort. Discipline rewarded. Security and beauty combined. Enjoying fruits of labor.
meaningRev: Independence thwarted by dependence or isolation. Self-sufficiency proving lonely or impossible. Luxury earned but not enjoyed. Refinement becoming pretension. Solitude imposed rather than chosen. The garden neglected or stolen. Material success empty of meaning. Discipline's rewards denied or proving insufficient.
description: A woman, with a bird upon her wrist, stands amidst a great abundance of grapevines in the garden of a manorial house. It is a wide domain, suggesting plenty in all things. Possibly it is her own possession and testifies to material well-being.

name: Ten of Pentacles
meaningUp: Legacy, inheritance, family wealth, tradition, lasting security. The culmination of material success. Generational blessing. Established family and home. Permanence, convention, the old ways that work. Wealth that extends beyond individual.
meaningRev: Legacy squandered or burdened with expectation. Inheritance delayed, contested, or destructive. Family wealth dividing rather than uniting. Tradition stifling or breaking down. Security proving unstable despite appearances. The estate crumbling. Generational curse rather than blessing. Convention oppressing rather than supporting.
description: A man and woman beneath an archway which gives entrance to a house and domain. They are accompanied by a child, who looks curiously at two dogs accosting an ancient personage seated in the foreground. The child's hand is on one of them.

name: Page of Swords
meaningUp: Curiosity, vigilance, mental agility, communications, truthfulness, the student of ideas. Quick wit, sharp tongue. News, messages, discoveries. The watchful scout. Intellectual honesty. Restless mental energy.
meaningRev: Curiosity becoming nosiness, or mental agility thwarted by confusion. Vigilance turning to paranoia or watchfulness failing. Communications blocked, delayed, or weaponized. Truthfulness becoming bluntness that harms. Unprepared, ill news. The scout unreliable. Mental energy scattered or used destructively.
description: A lithe, active figure holds a sword upright in both hands, while in the act of swift walking. He is passing over rugged land, and about his way the clouds are collocated wildly. He is alert and lithe, looking this way and that, as if an expected enemy might appear at any moment.

name: Knight of Swords
meaningUp: Action, speed, ambition, driven focus, intellectual pursuit. The charge ahead regardless of obstacles. Quick thinking, direct communication. Brave but potentially reckless. Fighting for truth and justice. Impatient, intense. Cutting through to the heart of matters.
meaningRev: Speed becoming recklessness confirmed, or action thwarted by obstacles not respected. Ambition corrupted or blocked. Focus scattered or narrowed to blindness. Communication harsh and destructive. Bravery as foolishness. Impatience causing disaster. The charge ending in ruin or retreat. Fighting for ego rather than truth.
description: He is riding in full course, as if scattering his enemies. In the design he is really a prototypical hero of romantic chivalry. He might almost be Galahad, whose sword is swift and sure because he is clean of heart.

name: Queen of Swords
meaningUp: Independence, clear judgment, direct communication, wisdom through sorrow. The one who has known loss and gained clarity. Honest counsel, cutting through pretense. Intellectual strength, objective analysis. The widow's wisdom. Protecting boundaries, demanding truth.
meaningRev: Independence becoming isolation, or judgment clouded by bitterness. Communication cruel rather than honest. Wisdom through sorrow turning to hardness of heart. Clear thinking becoming cold calculation. Boundaries protecting becoming walls isolating. The sharp tongue cutting to wound rather than illuminate. Clarity lost to resentment.
description: Her right hand raises the weapon vertically and the hilt rests on an arm of her royal chair the left hand is extended, the arm raised her countenance is severe but chastened; it suggests familiarity with sorrow. It does not represent mercy, and, her sword notwithstanding, she is scarcely a symbol of power.

name: King of Swords
meaningUp: Authority, intellectual power, truth, ethical judgment. The judge, the counselor, the law's executor. Mental mastery, logical analysis. Communication that commands respect. Discipline of mind. Power used justly. The sword in service of right order.
meaningRev: Authority misused or undermined, intellectual power corrupted or thwarted. Truth twisted or judgment compromised. The judge prejudiced, counsel self-serving. Mental mastery becoming manipulation. Communication dominating rather than enlightening. The sword serving tyranny or too weak to maintain order. Power without ethics.
description: He sits in judgment, holding the unsheathed sign of his suit. He recalls, of course, the conventional Symbol of justice in the Trumps Major, and he may represent this virtue, but he is rather the power of life and death, in virtue of his office.

name: Ace of Swords
meaningUp: Mental clarity, breakthrough, truth revealed, new ideas, justice, power of intellect. The sword of discernment cutting through confusion. Victory through clear thinking. The moment of breakthrough understanding. Raw mental power, sharp focus, penetrating insight. Communication clear and direct. Triumph of truth over falsehood.
meaningRev: Mental clarity clouded or becoming cold cruelty. Breakthrough thwarted by confusion, or truth revealed proving destructive. Justice perverted into vengeance. New ideas that prove harmful or fail to develop. Power of mind turned against self or weaponized against others. The sword cutting indiscriminately. Communication unclear, dishonest, or brutally harsh without wisdom.
description: A hand issues from a cloud, grasping as word, the point of which is encircled by a crown.

name: Two of Swords
meaningUp: Difficult choice, stalemate, avoidance, blocked emotions, refusing to see truth. The blindfolded figure balanced between two choices. Necessary pause before decision. Protection through withdrawal. Equilibrium maintained at cost of movement. Truce, but not peace.
meaningRev: Decision finally made or deadlock continuing indefinitely. Blindfold removed revealing painful truth, or remaining on to avoid necessary seeing. Avoidance that protected becoming avoidance that harms. Balance tipped suddenly. The truce broken, or deeper entrenchment making resolution impossible. Information revealed or deliberately obscured.
description: A hoodwinked female figure balances two swords upon her shoulders.

name: Three of Swords
meaningUp: Heartbreak, painful truth, sorrow, betrayal, separation. The pierced heart, grief given form. Betrayal, rejection, loss. The rain of sorrow. Clarity through suffering. Love wounded by truth.
meaningRev: Heartbreak beginning to heal or wound deepening into permanent damage. Painful truth avoided or finally accepted. Sorrow moving through its natural course toward recovery, or grief thwarted and turning toxic. Betrayal forgiven or compounded by further betrayal. The piercing swords being removed one by one, or driven deeper. Recovery beginning or relapse into deeper pain.
description: Three swords piercing a heart; cloud and rain behind.

name: Four of Swords
meaningUp: Rest, recuperation, contemplation, retreat. The knight at peace, gathering strength. Necessary pause, healing through stillness. Meditation, sanctuary, preparation for next phase. Strategic withdrawal. Peace after conflict.
meaningRev: Rest thwarted by inability to stop or circumstances forcing premature action. Recuperation incomplete or turning into permanent withdrawal from life. Contemplation becoming brooding. Strategic retreat becoming cowardly flight or denial of reality. The sanctuary invaded or voluntarily abandoned too soon. Preparation extending indefinitely, never converting to action.
description: The effigy of a knight in the attitude of prayer, at full length upon his tomb.

name: Five of Swords
meaningUp: Conflict with hollow victory, win at all costs, defeat, humiliation. The master of the field who has lost respect. Degradation through conquest. Getting what you want but losing what matters. Self-interest over ethics. The pyrrhic victory.
meaningRev: Hollow victory recognized and regretted, or defeat accepted with grace. The cycle of retaliation broken or escalating. Humiliation avenged or transcended. Self-interest abandoned for higher good, or pursued even more ruthlessly. The swords reclaimed or surrendered. Making amends or doubling down on destructive path.
description: A disdainful man looks after two retreating and dejected figures. Their swords lie upon the ground. He carries two others on his left shoulder, and a third sword is in his right hand, point to earth. He is the master in possession of the field.

name: Six of Swords
meaningUp: Transition, moving away from difficulty, journey toward calmer waters. Passage, safe travel. Leaving troubles behind, though not forgotten. The ferryman guiding safely. Mental shift, changed perspective. Refugee seeking safer shore. Moving through grief toward acceptance.
meaningRev: Transition thwarted, unable to leave difficulty behind. Journey delayed or destination proving no better than departure point. The passage unsafe, the ferryman unreliable. Troubles following across the water. Mental shift resisted. Trapped in difficult circumstances or fleeing rather than resolving.
description: A ferryman carrying passengers in his punt to the further shore. The course is smooth, and seeing that the freight is light, it may be noted that the work is not beyond his strength.

name: Seven of Swords
meaningUp: Strategy, stealth, getting away with something, deception, cunning. The thief in the camp. Self-reliance through questionable means. Clever plan that may backfire. Necessary strategic thinking or betrayal. Taking what's needed versus stealing. Partial success.
meaningRev: Strategy failing, caught in the act of deception, or honesty chosen over cunning. The clever plan exposed as foolish. Getting away with it or suffering consequences. Theft discovered. The taken swords recovered or the remaining swords also lost. Good advice rejected or bad advice followed. The camp awakened to danger.
description: A man in the act of carrying away five swords rapidly; the two others of the card remain stuck in the ground. A camp is close at hand.

name: Eight of Swords
meaningUp: Restriction, powerlessness, imprisonment by thought, trapped but not bound. The self-imposed prison. Believing escape impossible when it's not. Limited perspective, fear constraining action. Victim mentality. Paralysis through overthinking.
meaningRev: Restrictions lifted or tightening further. Escape realized or imprisonment becoming even more complete. The blindfold removed seeing true cage or true freedom. Victim mentality transcended or deepened. Fear overcome or conquering. The swords that bound revealed as removable or becoming actual chains.
description: A woman, bound and hoodwinked, with the swords of the card about her. Yet it is rather a card of temporary durance than of irretrievable bondage.

name: Nine of Swords
meaningUp: Anxiety, nightmares, guilt, mental anguish. The dark night of the soul. Worry overwhelming peace. Regret haunting sleep. Fear multiplied by imagination. Despair, isolation in suffering. The swords of the mind turned inward.
meaningRev: Anxiety lifting or spiraling completely out of control. The dark night passing or becoming permanent. Worry addressed or consuming. Guilt released or compounded. Nightmares fading or manifesting. Hope returning or despair deepening. The mental swords removed one by one or all plunging in at once.
description: One seated on her couch in lamentation, with the swords over her. She is as one who knows no sorrow which is like unto hers. It is a card of utter desolation.

name: Ten of Swords
meaningUp: Rock bottom, painful ending, betrayal, complete defeat. The worst has happened. Victim of cruelty or circumstance. The final blow, no lower to fall. Dramatic conclusion. The martyr, the backstabbed. End of cycle through destruction.
meaningRev: Recovery from rock bottom beginning, or falling even further than thought possible. The painful ending not as final as believed, or endlessly prolonged. Betrayal revealed or hidden. Rising from defeat or accepting it. The swords removed beginning healing, or final sword still to come. Refusing to stay down or unable to rise.
description: A prostrate figure, pierced by all the swords belonging to the card.
